    This page contains information about the older population in West Sussex as well as health and social care service use.

    Downloads

    West Sussex JSNA Older People Profiling

    Date added: 01/02/2017

    This profile collates data relating to the health and wellbeing of older people in West Sussex. Data are presented, in the main, at county level. District and CCG level information, where available, is on the JSNA website.

    West Sussex JSNA Older People Profiling, PDF document.

    Estimation of Need and Social Care Demand Management - West Sussex PH

    Date added: 01/02/2017

    This briefing aims to:

    1. Segment the West Sussex over 65 population in terms of social care need and demand (in terms of support for daily living activities, self-care and domestic tasks. Public Health has approached segmentation in terms of:
    2. Population characteristics
    3. Assumptions drawn from West Sussex GP patient data, using information on age and long term conditions.
    4. Existing patterns of social care demand, using data from WSCC Frameworki and Finance.
    5. Identify how provision supports people within, or moves people between segments/states.
    6. Provide a basic review the information required, and that available, to inform how our knowledge of demand.

    Estimation of Need and Social Care Demand Management - West Sussex PH, PDF document.

    Life expectancy at birth and age 65 years; 1993 - 2011

    Date added: 07/08/2013

    Life expectancy at birth and age 65: 1993 - 2011 at district level, presented with yearly trend graphs.

    Life expectancy at birth and age 65 years; 1993 - 2011, Excel Spreadsheet.

    Adult health, disabilities, services and mental health population projections for older people 2014 - 2029

    Date added: 10/04/2012

    Population projections for older people aged 65 and over from 2014-2029 based on the Projecting Older People Population Information System (POPPI) model.

    Adult health, disabilities, services and mental health population projections for older people 2014 - 2029, Excel Spreadsheet.

    Lives of older people in West Sussex survey; summary report 2013

    Date added: 16/12/2013

    West Sussex County Council conducted a telephone survey of 2803 residents aged 65+ and selected at random.

    The aims of the survey were to understand levels of loneliness, social isolation and participation in older people in the county and to obtain data on health, wellbeing and lifestyle.

    Lives of older people in West Sussex survey; summary report 2013, PDF document.

    Eye health - baseline evidence and service data

    Date added: 12/09/2013

    With a National Eye Health week established, this report on eye health presents information on the prevalence on eye conditions as well as information on sight tests by service user groups, cataract operations and the number of people registered blind in West Sussex.

    Eye health - baseline evidence and service data, Word document.

    Population in care homes by local authority census 2011

    Date added: 08/01/2014

    This document shows West Sussex having the 4th highest proportion of population aged 75+ of all counties in England and the 2nd highest proportion of people living in care homes.

    Population in care homes by local authority census 2011, Excel Spreadsheet.

    Please note: we are currently updating the West Sussex JSNA site so please check back soon for updates.
